intro: Porpax dickasonii, commonly known as the Dickason's porpax, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are arranged in dense clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
